arts.ttl: Leicester end goal drought to extend Brighton's winless run
arts.sum: Leicester City ended their Premier League losing streak and goal drought as they twice came from behind in a 2-2 draw with Brighton & Hove Albion, extending the Seagulls' winless run to four matches and denting their European hopes. Joao Pedro restored the Seagulls’ lead with another spot-kick but Caleb Okoli ’s first Premier League goal was enough to halt the Foxes’ losing run, and they even went close to a winner when Bilal El Khannouss struck a post.

arts.ttl: 'We need to' - Joao Pedro pinpoints where Brighton went wrong against Leicester after disappointing draw
arts.sum: Joao Pedro said everyone in the Brighton dressing room was ‘sad and frustrated’ after the 2-2 draw against Leicester City.

arts.ttl: Fabian Hurzeler: Brighton were too naive and not mature enough against Leicester
arts.sum: Caleb Okoli’s maiden goal in English football snapped second-bottom Leicester’s eight-match losing run.

arts.ttl: 'No' - Fabian Hurzeler's response to Lewis Dunk question will surprise Brighton fans after Leicester draw
arts.sum: Reaction from Brighton’s disappointing 2-2 draw against relegation-bound Leicester

arts.ttl: 'Shocker, wasteful' - Brighton player ratings vs Leicester City: One 4/10 and two 5/10s as sloppy Albion lose Europa League ground
arts.sum: How the Seagulls rated in their wasteful 2-2 draw against Leicester City

arts.ttl: Leicester City player ratings v Brighton as duo sparkle to stop the rot
arts.sum: After a club record run of eight straight defeats, City picked up a point at the Amex, Stephy Mavididi ending the long goal drought in response to Joao Pedro’s first-half penalty, and then Caleb Okoli heading in his maiden goal after the Brighton striker stuck away another spot-kick. However, City were a much greater threat on the attack thanks to the introduction of Mavididi, and in particular with his combination with Bilal El Khannouss, and midway through the half, the winger latched onto the Moroccan’s pass and blazed over.

arts.ttl: Leicester snap losing run after they end goal drought to draw at Brighton
arts.sum: Caleb Okoli’s maiden goal in English football earned the Foxes a deserved point in a 2-2 draw at the Amex Stadium.

arts.athr: Premier League Match Centre on X
arts.sum: Premier League statement confirms VAR awarded spot-kick due to 'sustained pull' on Matt O'Riley by Luke Thomas

arts.ttl: Brighton vs Leicester: Fabian Hurzeler chooses surprise Jan Paul van Hecke replacement as only one recognised centre back starts
arts.sum: Fabian Hurzeler has started just one recognised centre back for Brighton’s must-win Premier League match against Leicester City.
